attributes.action: Review insurers & help young people to get cheaper, affordable, car insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Example from:
https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/car-insurance/young-drivers

"The cost of car insurance for under-25s is eye-wateringly high and expected to continue to rise. 
The average cost for a 17-22 year-old is already over £1,400/yr"

Apprenticeships for those in low income families who lose child tax credits when a child starts an apprenticeship at 16 & whose pay is £3.30 per hour, makes such insurance unaffordable. How then can travel to apprenticeship happen?
attributes.background:
It is very difficult & often unaffordable for young people to drive. The ability to drive is important for work & therefore has additional effects on economy. 
Insurers do not make it easy for young people to start driving by making the premiums so high. Apprentice's cannot afford to pay insurance.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We understand that you're concerned about the cost of car insurance for young people, but we're not sure what action you'd like to see. 

You might like to sign this petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/202751

Alternatively, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
